PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17634

### PR summary [431d4046a9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17246/commits/431d4046a9b6100c0973790d7d5d12821aadce8e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimaryDecomposition`|1184|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Ideal.iInf_pow_eq_bot_of_isPrincipal_of_ne_top_of_zero_divisors_le`
`+ IsPrincipalIdealRing.of_isNoetherian_of_isPrincipal_maximal_of_zero_divisors_mem_jacobson`
`+ PreValuationRing.of_isMaximal_of_isNilpotent_of_isPrincipal`
`+ _root_.IsNilpotent.eq_zero_of_eq_pow_two_of_ne_one`
`+ coe_map`
`+ comap_mk_bot`
`+ dvd_bot`
`+ eq_pow_of_isMaximal_of_isNilpotent_of_isPrincipal`
`+ eq_top_of_isPrincipalIdealRing_quotient_of_zero_divisors_le_jacobson_bot_of_disjoint_aux`
`+ eq_top_of_isPrincipalIdealRing_quotient_of_zero_divisors_le_jacobson_bot_of_isPrincipal_of_le`
`+ isMaximal_eq_of_isNilpotent`
`+ isNilpotent_of_mem_isNilpotent`
`+ isUnit_or_mem_jacobson_bot_of_dvd_isNilpotent_of_zero_divisors_mem_jacobson_bot`
`+ noZeroDivisors_or_valuationRing_of_zero_divisors_mem_jacobson`
`+ pow_dvd_pow_iff_of_ne_zero_of_mem_jacobson_bot`
`+ span_singleton_eq_top_of_isPrincipalIdealRing_quotient_noZeroDivisors_zero_divisors_le_aux`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I think these are in the wrong file.

I'm not sure if this should be a simp lemma.
And I think `map f I = span (f '' I)` (without the `coe`) would be more useful.

The statement of this lemma looks very awkward to me. It seems to me that `hs` implies that `s` is a zero-divisor, so `hj` and `h0` imply Jacobson radical = zero-divisors = span {s}. Since minimal primes are contained in zero-divisors, this implies that `s` is prime, which then implies `s` is irreducible which is your goal.

I would suggest having a lemma `{x : R | âˆƒ y â‰  0, y * x = 0} <= nilradical R => IsPrime (nilRadical R)` instead.
`h` is `IsIdempotentElem`. And I don't think `h'` is necessary.
I believe you only need `hJ : J.IsPrime` and `hN : I <= nilradical R`.
The statement should be rephrased as `I <= nilRadical R`.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/PrimaryDecomposition): PIR of Noetherian under jacobson condition
